head.title: AGREEMENT TO SELL J. BAKER SHOE UNIT IS ENDED

hedline.hl1: AGREEMENT TO SELL J. BAKER SHOE UNIT IS ENDED

block.p: An agreement by J. Baker Inc. to sell a division, the Shoe Corporation of America, to Bain Capital and the division's management has been terminated, J. Baker said yesterday. It did not say why the sale had been canceled. In April, J. Baker had said it planned to sell the division to concentrate on other retail units, but terms were not disclosed. The company said yesterday that it would continue to try to sell the business, which runs leased footwear departments in 500 specialty and department stores. The shares of J. Baker, which is based in Canton, Mass., fell 62.5 cents yesterday, to $8.875, in Nasdaq trading.
